bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 151 (Friday, August 27, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LURIA:H.R. 5115.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:``U.S. Constitution, Article 8, Necessary and ProperClause''[Page H4494]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee
Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text: This bill requires specified appropriations for FY2022 and FY2023 to be used by the Coast Guard to improve facilities at the Coast Guard Yard in Baltimore, Maryland, including improvements to dock or dry dock, capital equipment improvements, or dredging necessary to facilitate access to such yard.

bill.title: To ensure funding for the improvement of the Coast Guard Yard in Baltimore, Maryland.

item.title: To ensure funding for the improvement of the Coast Guard Yard in Baltimore, Maryland.
To ensure funding for the improvement of the Coast Guard Yard in Baltimore, Maryland.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
